_header: Saint Valentine the martyr good man was enough
Subjects: saints’ lives; Valentine, saint, life of
_description: Life of St. Valentine in the South English Legendary — couplets

BodLauMis463.First Lines:
SEint Valentyn þe martyr god man was y nowAnd þorw his
                    preching many man To cristendom drow…
BodLauMis463.Last Lines:
…And his soule to heuene went þo þorw godes graceNow
                    god for þe loue of him vs bring to þat place
BodLauMis463.Note: Two columns per page, one full-line, the other half-line.

BodEngPoeta1.First Lines:
SEint valentin þe Martir good Mon was i nouhAnd
                    þoruȝ his prechinge mony mon to cristendam drouh…
BodEngPoeta1.Last Lines:
…And his soule to heuene wende al þorwh Godus graceNow
                    God for þe loue of him vs bringe to þat ilke place. Amen.
BodEngPoeta1.Facsimiles:
Doyle,  I. A.,
                        ed.  
             The Vernon Manuscript. A Facsimile of Bodleian Library, Oxford, MS Eng.
                poet.a.1,
          with an introduction by A. I. Doyle. Cambridge: D. S. Brewer, 1987. 
Scase,  Wendy,  and  Nick Kennedy, eds.  
             A facsimile edition of the Vernon manuscript: Oxford, Bodleian Library, MS. Eng. Poet. A. 1.
         Oxford: The Bodleian Library, 2011.

BodAsh43.First Lines:
SEyn valentyn þe martir good man was Inouȝ& þoru
                    is prechyng mony mon to cristendom drouȝ …
BodAsh43.Last Lines:
…& is soule to heuene wende þoru godes graceNou god
                    uor þe loue of him ous bringe to þulke place

BodTan17.First Lines:
SEint valentyn þe martir good man was I nouhAnd þour his
                    preching many men to cristindom drouh…
BodTan17.Last Lines:
…And his soule to heuen wente þo þorugh goddis
                    graceNov god for þe loue of him us bringe to sich place

OxfCCC431.First Lines:
[S]eint valentyn þe martir god man was ynow&
                    þurȝ his prechynge many man to cr[ist]endom drow…
OxfCCC431.Last Lines:
…& his soule to heuene wende þurȝ godes graceNow
                    god for his loue vs brynge to þulke place
OxfCCC431.Note: Portion of text lost due to mutilation of leaves.

CULAdd3039.First Lines:
Þe haly martir valentyne gude man he was ynogheÞurgh his
                    prechynge many a man to cristendam he drogheA grete maistre was þen at
                    rome Cratoun was his nameÞat mekil herde tell of valentyn & of his
                    haly fame…
CULAdd3039.Last Lines:
…& his saule til heuen went thurgh our lordeȝ
                    graceNow god for þe lufe of hym brynge vs to þat
                    place

CamCCC145.First Lines:
Sein valentin þe martir god man was InouAnd þoru is
                    prechinge many men to cristendom drou…
CamCCC145.Last Lines:
…And is soule to heuene wende þoru godes graceNou god for
                    þe loue of him us bringe to þulke place
CamCCC145.Editions:
D’Evelyn,  Charlotte,  and  A. J. Mill, eds.  
             The South English Legendary: Corpus Christi College Cambridge MS. 145
                and British Museum MS. Harley 2277, with variants from Bodley MS. Ashmole 43 and
                British Museum MS. Cotton Julius D.ix.
EETS
         o.s. 235 (1959), 236 (1956); repr. 1967: 1.61-2.

CamTCC605.First Lines:
SEint valentyn þe martere goud man was ynow& þoru
                    preching manye man to cristendom drow…
CamTCC605.Last Lines:
…& his saule to heuene wende þorȝe godes
                    gracegod for þe loue of hym ous brynge to þulke place

BLCottJulDIX.First Lines: SEint valentin þe martir godman was ynow& þorou his prechyng maniman to cristendon drow…
BLCottJulDIX.Last Lines: …& his soule to heuen wente þorou godes gracenou god for þe loue of him ous bringe to þilke place
BLCottJulDIX.Note: “Capitulum xv” added to right margin by later hand (f. 26).

Digital Facsimile of British Library  Cotton Julius MS D IX.

BLEge1993.First Lines: Seint Valentin þe martir god mon was inowAnd þorw is prechinge moni mon to cristendom drow…
BLEge1993.Last Lines: …His soule to heuene wende þorw oure lordes graceNow god for þe loue of him vs bringe to þat place
BLEge1993.Note:
Begins f. 111, not f. 11 as in Brown  and  Robbins (1943)
XCarleton Fairchild Brown,   and  Rossell Hope Robbins.  
             The Index of Middle English Verse.
         New York: Printed for the Index Society by Columbia University Press,
            1943; ends “Amen” (f. 111v).

TokyoTak54.First Lines:
Seint Valentyn þe marter good man was moweAnd þorgh his
                    preching many on to cristendom drowe…
TokyoTak54.Last Lines:
…His soule to heuene wente al þorgh goddis graceNowe god
                    for þe loue of hym bring vs to þat place. Amen.
